str2: Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Of Hebrew origin; Israel, the adopted name of Jacob, including his descendants.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To rescue, deliver (from danger or destruction).

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have come, be present, have arrived. A primary verb; to arrive, i.e. Be present.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Zion, the hill; used for Jerusalem or heaven. Of Hebrew origin; Sion, a hill of Jerusalem; figuratively, the Church.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To turn away, pervert, remove; I restore, replace; mid: I desert, reject. From apo and strepho; to turn away or back.
Impiety, irreverence, ungodliness, wickedness. From asebes; impiety, i.e. wickedness.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Of Hebrew origin; Jacob, the progenitor of the Israelites.
